Internship Experiences

Real stories from MEMS students about their internship experiences across different domains

Google

Summer Internship 2024

Corporate
May - August 2024
Stipend: $8000/month
Rahul Kumar (3rd Year)

My Experience

I worked on Google's internal data processing pipeline. The experience was incredible - I learned about large-scale systems, got mentorship from senior engineers, and contributed to real projects that impact millions of users.

What I Learned

  • ‚Ä¢ Large-scale distributed systems
  • ‚Ä¢ Data processing with Apache Beam
  • ‚Ä¢ Code review and best practices
  • ‚Ä¢ Working in a fast-paced environment

Tips for Future Interns

  • ‚Ä¢ Start learning the tech stack early
  • ‚Ä¢ Don't hesitate to ask questions
  • ‚Ä¢ Network with other interns
  • ‚Ä¢ Document your work thoroughly

Interview Process

Two technical rounds focusing on data structures, algorithms, and system design. The interviewers were friendly and focused on problem-solving approach rather than just getting the right answer.

Overall Rating

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ 5.0/5.0

MIT

Research Internship 2024

University
June - August 2024
Stipend: $4000/month
Priya Sharma (4th Year)

My Experience

I worked in the Mechanical Engineering department on advanced materials research. The environment was intellectually stimulating, and I got to work with cutting-edge equipment and brilliant researchers.

What I Learned

  • ‚Ä¢ Advanced materials characterization
  • ‚Ä¢ Research methodology and design
  • ‚Ä¢ Academic writing and presentation
  • ‚Ä¢ Collaboration in research teams

Tips for Future Interns

  • ‚Ä¢ Read relevant papers beforehand
  • ‚Ä¢ Be proactive in lab work
  • ‚Ä¢ Attend department seminars
  • ‚Ä¢ Build relationships with professors

Application Process

Applied through MIT's international programs office. Required strong academic record, research experience, and recommendation letters. The selection process was competitive but fair.

Overall Rating

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ 5.0/5.0

Tesla

Winter Internship 2024

Corporate
December 2024 - January 2025
Stipend: $6000/month
Arjun Patel (2nd Year)

My Experience

I worked in Tesla's manufacturing engineering team. The experience was intense but rewarding. I got to see the entire production line and contribute to process optimization projects.

What I Learned

  • ‚Ä¢ Manufacturing process optimization
  • ‚Ä¢ Quality control systems
  • ‚Ä¢ Lean manufacturing principles
  • ‚Ä¢ Working under pressure

Tips for Future Interns

  • ‚Ä¢ Be prepared for long hours
  • ‚Ä¢ Learn about automotive industry
  • ‚Ä¢ Focus on safety protocols
  • ‚Ä¢ Network with engineers

Interview Process

Technical interview focused on mechanical engineering fundamentals, manufacturing processes, and problem-solving. Also had a behavioral round to assess cultural fit.

Overall Rating

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ 4.0/5.0
